Key Match Events: The Knicks were torched by MVP hopeful Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 39 points
Isaiah Joe poured in 31 points, sinking 3-pointer after 3-pointer — eight of them altogether — at the Garden
OG Anunoby missed all of his shots during the first half
Post-Match Reflections: Mikal Bridges said the Knicks need to avoid letting missed shots drain their energy
Jalen Brunson said it's difficult to stop someone such as Joe when they're in rhythm and keep getting open attempts
Tom Thibodeau said defending the Thunder required a'second, third, fourth effort, and everyone has to be tied together on that'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks have allowed 126 or more points six times this season, and three of those have occurred within the past 15 days
The Knicks are officially a middle-of-the-pack defense — 15th in defensive rating entering Saturday's slate — after being a top-10 unit at the end of last year
Others: The Knicks' 3-point numbers have tanked, and Friday they ended a game with just four made shots from beyond the arc for the second time since Dec. 27
Jalen Brunson has converted multiple 3s in a game just once since Dec. 21
